intro: Cleidion praealtum, commonly known as the white sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
